p: The main endourology advances is the miniaturization of the endoscopic instruments without losing its effectiveness. The use of smaller ureteroscopes can prevent ureteral meatus dilation and potential complications. Therefore, it reduces the ureteral damage, as well as its bleeding or rupture and the necessity of postoperative double J stent placement. Some urologists publications describe the treatment of pelvic distal ureteral lithiasis in women by retrograde microureteroscopy, with 4.85 Fr sheath used by micropercutaneous approach. Subsequently, some cases of ureteral lithiasis in young children have been reported using the 4.8 Fr sheath as a ureteroscope ( 6).
